name: Teriyaki Chicken Bowl
description: Japanese-inspired sweet and savory teriyaki chicken. Served over rice with vegetables for a satisfying meal.

instructions.instruction: Rinse rice and cook with 2 cups water. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Make teriyaki sauce: Mix soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger.
instructions.tip: Sauce can be made ahead and stored for 1 week.

instructions.instruction: Dissolve cornstarch in 2 tbsp water and add to sauce. Mix well.
Heat a large pan or wok over high heat. Add 1 tbsp oil.
Add chicken pieces. Don't stir for 3 minutes, then flip.
instructions.tip: Don't overcrowd the pan - cook in batches if needed.

instructions.instruction: When chicken is golden, add broccoli and carrots. Stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Pour teriyaki sauce into the pan. Stir for 2-3 minutes until sauce thickens.
Divide rice into bowls. Top with teriyaki chicken and vegetables.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onion. Serve hot.

tips: Use low-sodium soy sauce to reduce sodium.
Don't overcook vegetables - keep them crisp-tender.
Perfect for meal prep - keeps well for 3-4 days.
Add a soft-boiled egg for extra protein.
storageInfo: Store in an airtight container for up to 4 days. Add a splash of water when reheating.
servingSuggestion: Serve with pickled cabbage (kimchi) or cucumber salad.
variations: Beef or shrimp can be substituted.
Use cauliflower rice for a low-carb version.
